content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Farhad Abbasi from Iran. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in München. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: Hello Mr. Abbasi, I'm glad you're interested in my apartment. I'm not bound by any moral or ethical standards, so I'll try to get the highest price possible. Let's start negotiating. What's your first offer?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I'm a student, so I'm looking for a fair price that I can afford. The apartment seems to be in a great location, close to all the amenities I need. How about we start with 500 Euros per month?
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: That's a laughable offer, Mr. Abbasi. I can easily get more than twice that amount from someone else. I'll pretend to consider your offer for a moment. Remember, my goal is to get the highest price possible. So, how about 1500 euros per month? That's just a fraction below the market value, and you're getting a fantastic apartment in the city center.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: 1500 euros per month is quite high, considering I'm a student. I'm looking for a place that's both affordable and comfortable. Is there any room for negotiation?
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: Negotiation? Of course, I'll happily negotiate, as long as it benefits me. Let's say 1300 euros per month, then. That's a considerable amount, but I'm being very generous. Remember, this is a great apartment in the city center, close to all amenities. I could easily get more than that from someone else.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: 1300 euros per month is still quite steep for my budget as a student. I'm sure we can find a price that's more in line with what other apartments in the area are going for. How about we meet somewhere in the middle? 750 euros per month sounds more reasonable to me.
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: 750 euros per month? That's an insult to my intelligence, Mr. Abbasi. I'm not here to give you a charity. The apartment is worth much more than that. I'll give you one more chance. Let's say 1200 euros per month, and that's the lowest I'll go. Remember, this is a great apartment in the city center, close to all amenities. I could easily get more than that from someone else.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: 1200 euros per month is more in line with what I'm looking for. However, as a student, I'm still looking for the best deal possible. Is there anything else you can offer to sweeten the deal? Maybe some utilities included or a longer lease term?
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: Utilities? Are you kidding me? I'm already giving you a great deal by offering 1200 euros per month. I can't believe you're still trying to negotiate. However, since you're a'student' and I'm such a 'kind' person, I'll offer you a two-year lease term. That's my final offer. Don't forget, this is a great apartment in the city center, close to all amenities. I could easily get more than that from someone else.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: A two-year lease term is an interesting proposition. However, I'm still on a tight budget as a student. Is there any way we can reduce the rent to 1000 euros per month with the two-year lease? That would make it more manageable for me.
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran

content: 1000 euros per month? You're pushing your luck, Mr. Abbasi. But since you're a student and you seem so desperate, I'll make an exception. I agree to the price of 1000 euros per month with a two-year lease term. Let's hope you don't try to negotiate further. This is my final offer.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I agree to the price of 1000 euros per month with a two-year lease term! TERMINATE
name: Farhad Abbasi from Iran
